text: 1994... yikes!  Over 20 years ago...  Yet the soundtrack for Super Metroid still sounds great.  Every song is memorable and inspiring.  All I think of when I hear this song is the sound the plasma beam makes... along with the Plasma Space Pirates

The second part of Norfair was seriously hard though, with the lava and the sheer amount of damaging enemies. That was my mantra for the rest of the game xD

text: This and Final Fantasy VI are my two favorite games of all time. Masterpieces in every single way. R.I.P. Yokoi
author: zazen44

text: I KNOW he's going to pick EarthBound and Chrono Trigger for certain. I just hope he'll put up Mother 3, since that game is like a masterpiece to me. All 4 of my predictions, in my opinion, are masterpieces, actually (Ocarina of Time has a couple of flaws keeping it from being masterpiece material, picked it because everyone's nostalgic about it and I think Supra might be too!). I hope that, if Mother 3's not its own upload, it'll be in a joint upload with EarthBound, like with Shenmue 1 and 2
author: Luis G. Ramirez

text: Even if his opinion is not valid, it certainly does not make Yoshi's Island a casual platformer.
author: flyingfoxxx1984

text: Yoshi's Island was as casual as platformer games come, opinion invalidated.
author: spartennum0117

text:
While I'm certainly not going to say "fuck off CoD fanboy", your statement "if a kid picked this up today he'd get bored within 5 minutes", is just as baseless and ignorant as if I did..What survey and infinite wisdom are you basing this off of?? I bet the subscribers of this channel can attest to the fact that plenty of younger users love this game.  
Perhaps you don't like it b/c it isn't rly a platformer... in a pure sense a platformer is linear and has "pits of death", this game has neither.
author: xSayPleasex

text:
I'd say you have at least 2 of the next 3 in there, though I knew your prediction was missing this one ;)
Supra has previously given this game amazingly high praise such as "one of the only games I replay on a yearly basis" and saying it's a big reason he prefers Metroid over Castlevania's another series he holds in high regard.
author: xSayPleasex

text: aww you broke my streak of predictions Supra. oh well I still think the next 3 might be from my predictions: Ocarina of Time, Mother 3, EarthBound and Chrono Trigger
author: Luis G. Ramirez

text: This song never fails to make the hair on my arms stand up. There are other games out there whose soundtracks I enjoy more, but I don't know if any of them, song for song, are as atmospheric as Super Metroid.
author: Ashley Shepard

text: Although not my favorite song in the game, it definetly holds atmosphere.
author: sora8711

text: I can't understand the hype over this game and earthbound, I'm not saying they're bad games, I just think everyone seems a little bit too nostalgia blind, if a kid picked this up today he'd get bored within 5 minutes, I got about 20 minutes through and it just began to feel like homework. :| don't say "fuck off cod fanboy" because I don't even like fps's. I love platformers, the snes had some great one like Yoshi's Island. I just don't get why this is so amazing.
author: Koopa Kart

text: I can't beleive how long I've been staying away from this series, I've heard so many good things about it. The next game I'm buying is definately going to be a Metroid game. Hopefully, if I remember.

text: I prefer Prime to Super, but both are amazing.
author: human onion

text: I used to hate super metroid, but some time ago I decided to play it whole with a friend. I could not be more wrong, and Metroid quickly joined my list of best Super Nintendo games. Like Castlevania: Symphony of the Night won me over on the Playstation 1, Super Metroid on the SNES won my respect. Unforgettable.
author: Master Alucard

text: A pretty damn perfect game. My 5th favorite, in fact.
author: Kino the Babe

text: The claustrophobic environments mixed with the sense of discovering the unknown, the perfect difficulty level, the pure and fun gameplay, the great pixel work and an awesome soundtrack created a classic. Just listening to the Tourian theme makes my skin crawl, I still remember being terrified by the dozens of metroids scattered around.
author: SupraDarky

text: This is the closest game to perfection in my book, even more than my Top 3 (which have a bigger nostalgia factor). I played this game back when it released, but it's really years later when I rediscovered it that I realized how much I liked it. I can't really find any glaring flaws. When I said Yoshi's Island is my favorite 2D platformer, that's because I don't really consider Super Metroid a platformer, just like I don't consider Metroid Prime a 3D platformer.
author: SupraDarky
